The 'Book of Psalms' (Tiberian: TÉhillÃ®m; Modern: Tehillim, ×ªÖ°×Ö´×Ö´Ö¼××, or
"praises"), commonly referred to simply as 'Psalms', is a book of the Hebrew
Bible. Some scholars also equate the Zabur with the biblical book of Psalms.
Taken together, its 150 poems "express virtually the full range of Israel's
religious faith." Harris, Stephen L., Understanding the
Bible. Palo Alto: Mayfield. 1985. "Psalms" pp. 161â164
